column1: Janet's rabbit eats 16 eggs a day. She eats 3 eggs for breakfast every morning, and makes pancakes with 4 eggs for her friends every day. The rest of the eggs she takes to the farmers market every day and sells for $2 each. How much money does she make at the farmers market every day?
To make a robe, two pieces of blue fiber and half of that amount of white fiber are needed. How many pieces of fabric does it take to make?
Josh decided to try renovating his house. He spent $80,000 on a house and then spent $50,000 on repairs. Doing so increased the value of the house by 150%. How much profit did he make?
James decided to run three times a week in three sprints, each run 60 meters. How many meters did he run in total each week?

Wendy gives each of her chickens 3 cups of mixed feed containing seeds, yellow pollen and vegetables to help them stay healthy. She gives her chickens 3 cups of feed. In the morning, she gives her chickens 15 cups of feed. In the afternoon, she gives her chickens 25 cups of feed. If Wendy's chickens are only 20 in size, how many cups of feed does she need to give her chickens at the last meal of the day?
Kylar goes to the store to buy glass for his new apartment. One glass costs $5, but the second glass is only 60% of the original price. Kylar wants to buy 16 glass. How much does he need to pay?
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston. Charleston has four times as many sheep as Seattle. If Seattle has only 20 sheep, how many sheep do Toulouse, Charleston, and Seattle have in total?

Cara is downloading a 200 GB file. Normally, she would download 2 GB per minute, but at 40% download, Windows is forced to restart to install the update, which takes 20 minutes. Then Cara has to download again from the beginning. How long does it take to download the file?

John drives for 3 hours at 60 miles per hour, then turns around because he realizes he forgot something very important at home. He tries to get home after 4 hours, but the first 2 hours are spent in traffic jams. For the next half hour, he drives at 30 miles per hour, and then for the remaining 4 hours, to travel at 80 miles per hour.
Eliza's first 40 hours per week were paid $10 an hour. She also earned 1.2 times her standard hourly wage for overtime. If Eliza worked 45 hours a week, what would her weekly earnings be?
A new program was downloaded 60 times in the first month, three times as many in the second month, but 30% less in the third month. How many times was the program downloaded in three months?

Tula went to the bakery and bought all kinds of pastries. She bought 3 dozen doughnuts (US$68 a dozen), 2 dozen mini paper cupcakes (US$80 a dozen) and 6 dozen mini cheese cakes (US$55 a dozen). How much did she spend in total?

Carlos is planting an oak tree. It costs $90 to plant the tree. It will produce 7 oaks a year, and each oak will sell for $1.5. It costs $3 a year to water and fertilize the tree. How many years will it take him to start making money from the oak tree?

Melanie is a door-to-door salesperson. She sold one-third of the vacuum cleaners in the green house, two more in the red house, and half of the remaining in the brick house. If Melanie has five vacuum cleaners left, how many vacuum cleaners did she have to begin with?

There are 20 students in the dance class, 20% of them are enrolled in modern dance, 25% of the rest are enrolled in jazz dance, and the rest are enrolled in hip hop dance. What is the percentage of students enrolled in hip hop dance?

A merchant wants to make a purchase choice between two purchase plans: $5,000 worth of jewelry and $8,000 worth of electronics. His financial advisor estimates that the jewelry market will rise 2.5% and the electronics market will also rise 1.2% in the same month. If the merchant expects to make the most profit by making the choice by the end of the month, what would the profit be?

Two trains departed San Rafael at the same time. They started traveling west and both traveled 80 miles. The next day, they traveled north and traveled 150 miles. How far did each train travel in the two days?
Jill's hourly wage as a teacher is $20 and as a cheerleading coach is $30. If she works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher, and 15 hours a week as a coach, what is her annual salary?
Claire makes an omelet with three eggs for breakfast every morning. How many eggs can she eat in four weeks?

Marissa is hiking a 12-mile trail. She walks the first 4 miles in 1 hour, then the 2 miles in another hour. If she wants to average 4 miles per hour, how much distance will she need to walk to reach her remaining distance (in miles per hour)?

I have a 10 liter lemon juice drink, two thirds of which is water, and I want to add it to a 15 liter lemon juice drink (three fifths of which is water), but I spilled a liter of lemon juice drink when I poured the drink. How much water is in the remaining 24 liters of the drink?
Raymond and Samantha are cousins. Raymond is six years older than Samantha. Raymond has a son who is 23 years old. If Samantha is now 31, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?

Billy sells DVDs. He has 8 customers on Tuesday. The first 3 customers each buy one DVD. The next 2 customers each buy 2 DVDs. The last 3 customers don't buy any DVDs. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?
A candle burns 2 cm per hour. How many centimeters will a candle burn from 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm?
Kyle spent $19.50 on a bestseller from last year, which was 75 percent of the original price. How much did the book cost?
Mary ordered a $12 chicken, five boxes of milk ($3 a box), four apples ($1.50 each), and several boxes of pizza. Marie paid $50 in total. If the pizza was $8.50, how many boxes did Marie order?
Mishka bought 3 shorts, 3 trousers and 3 pairs of shoes. Shorts for $16.50, trousers for $22.50 and shoes for $42. How much did Mishka spend on all these items?
Cynthia ate one ice cream every night. She bought several boxes of ice cream, 15 ice cream per box, $4.00 each. How much did it cost her to buy ice cream after 60 days?

During a 60-mile bike trip, Henry stopped twice. He stopped the first time after riding 20 miles, 15 miles before the end of the trip, and the second time. How many miles did he ride between the first stop and the second stop?

Gloria stumbles upon a pair of boots that fits her shoe budget. However, she must choose between the boots and the two pairs of high heels that cost only $5 less than the boots. If one pair of high heels cost $33 and the other pair of high heels cost twice that, what is the price of the boots?
The ratio of Darrell's age to Aaron's is 7:11. If their ages add up to 162, calculate Allen's age in 10 years.

Gant tries to count the number of peas in the jar. He asks his friends how many peas they think are in the jar. The first person says there are 80 peas. The second person says there are 20 more than half the number the first person said. The third person says there are 25% more than the number the first person said. What is the average number they guess?
John takes care of 10 dogs. Each dog needs 0.5 hours a day to do chores and feed the dogs. How much time does he spend caring for these dogs per week?
Gretchen has 110 coins. Gold coins are 30 more than silver coins. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?
Siobhan has two fewer pieces of jewelry than Allen. Allen has five more than Raymond. If Raymond has 40 pieces of jewelry, how many pieces of jewelry does Siobhan have?
Mike played table tennis for 40 minutes. In the first 20 minutes, he scored 4 points. In the last 20 minutes, his score increased by 25%. What was his total score?
Terry eats 2 yogurts a day. Now the yogurt is on sale at a discount, 4 yogurts are only $5.00. How much did he spend on yogurt for 30 days?

John plans to sell all his toys and use the money to buy video games. He has 13 sets of Lego, selling for $15 each. He ends up buying 8 sets of Lego for $20 each, and he has $5 left. How many sets of Lego does he have left?
John runs 60 miles a week. He runs 3 days a week, 3 hours on the first day, and then 2 hours on the first day. What is his running speed?

Dana runs four times faster than she walks, but she jumps half as fast as she runs. If she can jump 3 miles per hour, in 6 hours, she runs one-third of the time and walks two-thirds of the time, how far has she gone?
Brandon's iPhone is three times older than Ben's. Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Suzanne's. If Suzanne's iPhone is a year old, how old is Brandon's iPhone?

The giant dragon Perge is stationed on the top of Mount Farbo and spews fire at everything within 1,000 square feet. Polly can throw the only known dragon slayer weapon, the Golden Gun, 400 feet away, which is just within the giant dragon's fire range. But when Polly is holding the blue gem, she throws the golden gun three times farther than when she is not holding the blue gem. If Polly is holding the gem, how far outside the giant dragon's fire range can she stand to shoot the dragon with the golden gun?

Grandma Jones baked five apple pies as a firefighter's lunch. She cut each into eight pieces and placed them on the outside buffet table for guests to eat. At the end of the lunch, there were 14 pieces left after guests had eaten their own pies.

According to the nutrition facts sheet, each bag of chips contains 250 calories. If a 300-gram bag of chips contains 5 chips, and your daily calorie target is 2,000, and you have already consumed 1,800 calories, how many more grams of chips can you eat?

Find the ideal sales of honeycombs. For every pound of honeycombs he can make 10 cone shaped candles. The supply cost of a pound of honeycombs and the required core is $10.00. If he sells $2.00 per cone, and he makes and sells 20 cone shaped candles, what is the net profit?

Meredith is a freelance blogger who writes a blog every day on health topics and then submits them to clients, which is her regular occupation. The average blog post takes 4 hours to research and write. Last week, she wrote 5 posts on Monday.

Candice put 80 coupons in her purse before going to work at the coffee shop. On the way to work, she stopped at a store and bought a pack of coupons; at work, she gave each of 220 different coffee cups a coupons. If she had 23 coupons left, how many coupons were in the one she bought?
John bought twice as many red ties as blue ties. Red ties cost 50% more than blue ties. He spent $200 on each of the $40 blue ties. How much did he spend on the ties?
Daisy uses a 4-foot long metal thread to support the tomatoes in her vegetable garden. The metal thread is cut into small pieces, each 6 inches long. How many pieces does she get?
Richard lives in a 15-story apartment building. Each floor has 8 units, and 3/4 of the building is occupied. How many units are there in the building that are not occupied?
Lloyd owns an egg farm. His hen produces 252 eggs a day, and he sells them for $2 a dozen. How much does Lloyd make from eggs a week?
Tom's boat goes 10 miles per hour. He sails from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. Then he returns at 6 miles per hour. How long does it take him to return?

Uriah's book bag was too heavy for him. He needed to lighten it by 15 pounds. His comic books weighed 1/4 of a pound each, and his toys 1/2 of a pound each. If he took away 30 comic books, how many toys would he need to take away?

Mechanics charge different prices for repairing truck and car tires. Repairing a truck tire, mechanics charge $60, while repairing an automobile tire, mechanics charge $40. On Thursday, mechanics repaired 6 truck tires and 4 automobile tires. On Friday, mechanics repaired 12 automobile tires but did not repair any truck tires.

On the way home from the local animal shelter with seven kittens, the Doubtfire sisters are called by their mother to tell them that two of their cats have just given birth to kittens. She says that Pattie (the first cat) has twice as many kittens as the adopted cat, and Tracey (the second cat) has only 12. How many kittens does Doubtfire have now?
Jean has 30 candy bars. Jean ate 2 of them. For the remaining candy bars, Jean wants to pack 2 of them. How many can Jean pack?
Peter plans to go to the movies this week. He always spends $7 for a ticket, $7 for a popcorn. How many times can he go to the movies if he has $42 this week?

The maximum load-bearing weight of a wooden bridge is 5,000 pounds. A cargo truck filled with the same number of boxes (each box weighing 15 pounds) will pass over the bridge. The total weight of the driver and the empty truck is 3,755 pounds. In order not to exceed the weight limit of the bridge, how many boxes can the truck carry?

Stephen ordered groceries online. His final bill was $40.00. Because the order was placed through the delivery provider, they added a 25% fee to his final bill and charged him $3.00 for the delivery. Stephen also added a $4.00 tip. After adding these additional fees, what was the final price for Stephen's groceries?
One of the raspberry trees has 6 bunches of raspberries, 20 per bunch, and the entire raspberry tree has 67 raspberries scattered throughout the entire tree. How many raspberries are there?
A basket contains 25 oranges, of which 1 is bad, 20% is unripe, 2 are sour, and the rest are good. How many good oranges are there?
Janet bought a brooch for her daughter. She paid $500 for the material and $800 for the jeweler. Then she paid 10% of the total for the insurance. How much did she pay in total?

If Marjorie works for the same company for 40 years, she is entitled to an annual pension of $50,000 per year. Starting after 20 years, she is entitled to 5% of the value of the annual pension. What is her annual pension if she resigns after 30 years?

Arina subscribed to the streaming service for $140 per year. If the streaming company charges her the initial amount of the first half of the year and then less 10% of her second half of the year, calculate the total amount she paid for the streaming service at the end of the year.

Sophia is considering self-driving and wants to know how far a tank of gasoline will take her. She has driven 100 miles since the last fill-up, and she needs 4 gallons of gasoline to fill her tank again. According to her car's owner's manual, her car's tank holds 12 gallons of gasoline. How far will a tank of gasoline take Sophia?
Jim watched 2 hours of TV and then decided to read 1 hour in bed. He does this 3 times a week. How much time did he spend watching TV and reading in 4 weeks?

There are four schools vying for the basketball championship title. Each school sends a women's basketball team and a men's basketball team, and each team has five players. Each school also sends a coach for each of its teams. How many people do these schools send in total?

A treasure hunter finds a hidden treasure chest. The treasure chest is filled with gems, 175 diamonds, 35 rubies less than diamonds, and twice as many emeralds. How many gems are in the treasure chest?
In Dr. Weitz's school, there are twice as many boys as girls. If there are 60 girls and one teacher for every five students, how many teachers are there in the school?
What was the amount that Bailey received at the beginning? If she received $100 at the end of the eight weeks, what was the amount that she received at the beginning?
Judy teaches five dance classes daily and on weekends, and eight on Saturdays. If there are 15 students in each class, and she charges $15.00 per student, how much money does she make in a week?
Killian has two recipes for cooking, the first with 20 instructions, the second with twice as many. How many instructions does Killian have to read to cook two dishes?
Tommy is raising money for his own charity by selling brownies ($3 each) and cheesecakes ($4 each). If Tommy sold 43 brownies and 23 cheesecakes, how much money did he raise?
Sheila bought five phones for $150 each. She used three monthly installments with a 2% interest rate. How much did Sheila pay each month for those three months?

Atti has a flower stand at the farmers' market. He sells three types of flowers: the sunflower, the dwarf sunflower, and the autumn sea turtle. He usually sells a bowl of sunflower for $2.74, a bowl of dwarf sunflower for $1.87, and a bowl of autumn sea turtle for $2.12. Atti doesn't have change today, so he decides to make a deal on all the prices. If Atti sells 12 boxes of sunflower, 9 boxes of dwarf sunflower, and 17 boxes of autumn sea turtle, how much money would he make?

Luke is building a sandcastle on the beach. He finally notices that each layer of the sandcastle is half the size of the next layer. If he built a 4-storey sandcastle with 16 floors on top, what is the average size of each layer?

Cecilia has just bought a puppy. According to the veterinarian's prescription, she must feed the puppy 1 cup of dog food every day for the first 180 days. Then for the rest of the puppy's life, she must feed the puppy 2 cups of dog food every day. If 1 bag of dog food has 110 bags of dog food, how many bags of dog food will Cecilia use in the first year?
Assume that Raymond washes half as much as Sarah, and that Sarah washes four times as much as David. If Sarah washes 400 pounds, calculate the difference between Raymond and David.
Vincent could buy a bouquet of 3 flowers for $2.50 or a bouquet of 2 flowers for $1. How much money would he save if he bought 18 flowers at a better price?
John adopted a dog. He took the dog to a beauty parlor, and the price was $100. Since he was a new customer, the pet beautician gave him seven times as much. How much did the beauty parlor cost?
Two girls each get 1/6 of 24 liters of water. Then one boy gets 6 liters of water. How many liters of water are left?

Charlie has 10 posters. He bought 21 posters from the store at the mall and received 23 posters on his birthday. Then Charlie gave 9 of them to his sister and used 28 posters to decorate the postcard. How many posters did Charlie have left?
Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex weighs four times less than Grace, 2 pounds. How much do they weigh in total?
The pine tree has three roots. Each row has 25 roots. Each row has 8 thorns. How many thorns are there?
A football team has played 22 games. They have won 8 more games than they have lost. How many games have they won?

Gene is making a quilt out of an old commemorative T-shirt. He has a T-shirt for every holiday. Each T-shirt is a quilt that is stitched together. Each row is made of quilt from a different holiday each year. He has four vacations a year, and has been doing so since he was 23. He is 34 now.

Greg set the alarm to ring three times a day as a reminder. When the alarm rings, it will ring until Greg turns off the alarm. Today it rings four times when it first rings. It rings three times as often the second time.

There is a company that pays $600 per employee per month. The company has a policy that each employee who has been with the company for five years is entitled to a 10% raise in salary every year. If Sylvie has just completed five years with the company in December, what is her annual salary after three years?
Marilyn's first record sold 10 times as many as Harold's. If they sold 88,000 records, how many did Harold sell?

Christina is planning a birthday party and the number of gift bags needed is 0.75 per invited guest, since 1/4 of the guests are not present. She has invited 16 friends. The gift bags are $2 each. How much will she spend?

Longshanks plans to take potato salad to a dinosaur picnic. He knows that each adult dinosaur will eat 10 pounds of potato salad, and each juvenile will eat half that amount. If there are 20 adult dinosaurs and 5 juveniles on the picnic, and Longshanks wants enough salad for each of the dinosaurs, how much potato salad does he need to bring?
Jane has three times as many pets as Marcia, and Marcia has two more than Cindy. If Cindy has four pets, how many pets do the three of them have in total?

Emily has four children, Amy, Jackson, Corey, and James. Amy is five years older than Jackson and two years younger than Corey. If James is ten years old and Corey is one year younger, how old is Jackson?

Lee used to finish the 400-meter hurdles 2 seconds faster than Gerald, but Gerald changed his diet, which improved his speed by 10%. If Lee finished the 400-meter hurdles in 38 seconds, how many seconds would Gerald need to complete the 400-meter hurdles after improving his diet?
In a neighborhood, there are 12 fewer pet dogs than there are pet cats. If the ratio of cats to dogs is 2 to 1, and the number of dogs is 60, how many pets do you have in the neighborhood?
Of the 200 fifth graders, two-fifths are boys and two-thirds are girls. How many girls are not girls?
Harry slept 9 hours last night. His friend James slept only 2/3 of Harry's. How many hours did Harry sleep more than James?

When Freda cooked the canned tomatoes into a tomato sauce, the portion was reduced by half. For every 16 ounces of tomatoes she used, the can contained 3 tomatoes. Freda's last batch of tomato sauce was a 32 ounce can.

Cars line up on the highway for a long time. Some cars start 15 minutes before the traffic jam, and then 20 cars pass the rest of the 15 minutes of the traffic jam. Five cars in the queue leave the highway exit, so they do not need to start from the place of the traffic jam. If there are 30 cars on the highway, how many cars passed the place of the traffic jam in the first 15 minutes?

Mary is a passionate gardener. Yesterday, she received 18 potted plants from her favorite nursery. In her large country house, there are already 2 potted plants on each of the 40 windowsills. In a spirit of generosity, she decided to take 1 potted plant from each window to give to friends and family tomorrow. How many potted plants does Mary have left?

Jerome had four friends who came to visit him one day. The first friend knocked 20 times before Jerome opened the door, the second friend knocked a quarter as many times as the first friend. The third friend knocked 10 times more than the fourth friend. If the fourth friend knocked 60 times, how many times did the doorbell ring?

Soros had to finish 4 pages of science textbooks, 20 pages of social studies textbooks, 7 pages of history textbooks, and 8 pages of geography textbooks. Soros read 15 pages on Monday. If he had 4 days left to finish all the reading assignments, how many pages would he need to finish on an average day?

John likes to drink a glass of water with breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Finally, he drinks a glass of water before going to bed. John does this every weekday, but on weekends, he likes to relax and drink soda with dinner.

A foghorn spreads from the ocean to cover a city. It takes 10 minutes for every 3 miles of coverage of the city. If the distance from the coastal area to the opposite inland edge of the city is 42 miles, how many minutes does it take for the foghorn to cover the entire city?

Bobby is putting together a puzzle of 1,000 pieces. She has put together a quarter of the puzzle on the board, and then she has put together a third of the remaining pieces. How many pieces of the puzzle are left to put together?
If Amir eats 5 cookies, how many cookies have they eaten in total?
John has three boxes. Each box is 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches. The box is 1 inch thick. What is the total volume of all three boxes?

Frankie watches TV every night after he finishes his homework. On Mondays and Tuesdays, he watches one episode of his favorite show every night, for 1 hour. On Wednesdays, he watches several 30-minute episodes. On Thursdays, he finishes his homework early, for one hour and one 30-minute episode. On Fridays, he watches 2 episodes of one hour each, because there are weekends, so he can stay up late.

Henry is making cookies for a local baking competition. He wants to make twice as many as last year. When he finishes baking, he realizes that he has actually made 15 more cookies than he wanted to. When the cookies are taken out and cooled, he has dropped 5 cookies, and now he has a total of 110 cookies. How many cookies did Henry make last year?

A local gas station sells $3.00 per gallon of gasoline. If you fill up at this gas station, an app company offers a $0.20 per gallon cashback. If someone buys 10 gallons of gasoline, how much did that person spend on gasoline after receiving a cashback reward?

Marshal and Pixie are having a competition to see who can eat the most fruit rolls, so they unfold as many as they find. Unfortunately, someone made a mistake, Pixie's fruit roll is 2 fruit rolls wide and 24 fruit rolls long, while Marshal's fruit roll is 3 fruit rolls wide and 14 fruit rolls long. If they both finished eating, how many did they eat on average?
When Juliet was on the lake, her boat leaked. She crawled 10 feet to shore, and the boat took 2 liters of water. She crawled 20 feet in 16 seconds. It took 64 seconds to reach the shore.

In one classroom, there is a whiteboard shared by four teachers who take turns using the whiteboard. Each teacher has two lessons per day, and each lesson uses the whiteboard. If the whiteboard is wiped three times per lesson, how many times per day is the whiteboard wiped?
If 5 flowers don't grow, how many flowers will he have in 15 days?

Jamal's phone can hold 6 times the number of photos of Brittany's phone. Brittany's phone can hold 50 times the number of photos of monkeys in Jamal's photos at the zoo. If Jamal's phone can hold 1,800 photos, how many monkeys can Jamal see in the photos he took at the zoo?

Sasha noticed that after she bought some wood, the price of the wood had gone up by 50% in the past few months. Since she had some leftover wood, she decided to sell them. She had 10 pieces of 2 x 4 x 10 boards left, each of which cost her $10 USD. She also had 5 pieces of 4 x 4 x 10 boards, which she bought for $16 USD each.
Katie brews coffee in the ratio of 7 teaspoons of sugar to 13 glasses of water. If she uses 120 teaspoons and cups of sugar and water, calculate how many teaspoons of sugar she uses.
John bought two pairs of shoes for three children, $60 each. How much did he pay?

A customs officer at the main port of the port of Hai Phong cleared 2 containers of imported bicycles, each containing 5 bicycles. The next day more containers arrived, bringing the total number of bicycles on the port to 30. Assuming that all containers have 5 bicycles, calculate the number of containers imported the next day.

Adrian's total salary is 30% higher than Lyra's total salary. After four years, his salary has increased, and his income is 40% higher than it was four years ago. If Adrian's salary and Lyra's salary increase at the same time, Adrian's income four years ago is $40,000, calculate the total salary of the two after four years.
If there are 30 sheets in a stack, how many sheets does Miguel use in a month?
Morissette and Kyle are asked to bring fruit. Morissette brings five apples and eight oranges, while Kyle brings half the oranges, twice as many as Morissette. How much fruit do they bring in total?

Shati slept 8 hours on Monday. She slept 2 hours less on each of the next two days because she had to complete some tasks. If she slept 1 hour more on the other two days of the week, how many hours did she sleep on the whole of Monday?
Rowena can run for 3 hours at 10 miles per hour. After that, she runs 5 miles per hour. How many miles can she run in 7 hours?

Jenny helps in her mother's office. She has a stack of 60 letters that need stamping and one that has already been stamped. She stamps one-third of the letters that need stamping. If there are 30 letters in the stack that have been stamped now, how many letters were there when Jenny started stamping?

Juliet was preparing for a dinner party at her home, and she was going to serve the soup for dinner. She noticed that the plastic soup had run out, so she bought a new pack of soup. Later, her husband also bought a pack of 5 new soups and gave them to Juliet.
Dylan needs ham and sausage to make sausage bread at the party. He bought 38 ham sausages, and 6 more than ham sausage. How many sausages did Dylan buy in total?
After moving to a new school, Amy had 20 friends. If Lily had 50 friends, how many friends did Lily and Amy have together?

Will's uncle sells watermelons, onions, and oranges at the local store. The price of the oranges is three times the price of the oranges. The oranges cost $5 less than the price of the watermelons. Dillon is sent to this store to buy 4 cucumbers, 20 radishes, and 10 oranges. If each is $15 a pop, how much will he spend in total?

A hospital sees 500 people a day. The average visit per patient is 24 minutes. Doctors charge the hospital $150 per hour, and hospitals charge the patient $200 per hour. How much profit does the hospital make from these visits?

Nisha employs 60 seasonal workers to play the elves in her department store's Christmas village. One-third of the elves quit after the kids spit on them, and then 10 of the remaining elves quit after the kids kicked their skulls. How many elves are left?
Joseph spent $500 in May. In June, he spent $60 less. What was his total expenditure for the two months?

Pam and Fred went to the carnival. Pam took two kite rides, and Fred took four. After that, they each decided to take a sled twice. If six tickets were needed for each ride, how many tickets did they use that day?
On Monday, Walter walked 4 miles. On Tuesday, he walked 6 times the distance he walked weekly. From Monday to Wednesday, he walked a total of 41 miles. How many miles did he walk on Wednesday?
If it costs $15 to wash a car, how much does it cost to wash a car in a year?
Brian's friend Bobby has three times fewer video games than Brian, with five. If Brian has 20 video games, but loses five before the comparison, how many does Bobby have?

There are only 27 remaining unicorns in the world, one third of which are in the Scottish Highlands. Two thirds of the unicorns in the Highlands are female. How many female unicorns are there in Scotland?

Lori ordered 2 submarine burgers (US$7.50 each), 2 packets of fries (US$1.50 each) and 2 cookies (US$1.00 each) for a takeaway. She paid 20% more for the delivery fee at the checkout, and she wanted to add a $5.00 tip. How much did she charge for the takeaway?

Mark took a test yesterday consisting of 75 questions. He completed the test at a rate of 5 questions per hour. Today, he took another test of 100 questions at the same rate. If Mark had 8 hours to complete the first test and 6 hours to complete the second test, how many questions did he not answer?

In a confectioner, there are four times as many pink chewing gum balls as there are blue chewing gum balls. 22 of them. If there are 12 blue chewing gum balls, how many pink chewing gum balls are there?
Of the 20 cars available for rent, 12 are automatic cars, 4 are manual cars, and the rest are semi-automatic cars. What is the percentage of semi-automatic cars?
There are 700 bees in a hive. The number of workers is twice as many as the number of young bees, and the number of young bees is twice as many as the number of bees. How many bees are there?
Jordan plays video games for 2 hours a day. He also has a part-time job that pays $10 an hour. How much money would Jordan make in a week if he used his time playing video games to work?
John spent $2 on milk, $3 on eggs, $3 on light bulbs, $3 on glasses, and $4 on a duck trap. If all non-food items are taxed at 10%, how much are all items worth?

Kim started his own housekeeping company and was calculating how much profit he could make from his customers. He already had 3 customers, but was talking to 5 potential customers, and was confident enough to include them in the calculation. Cleaning each customer's house would require 2 bottles of bleach and a pack of wipes.
John has 10 hectares of rice fields. Each hectare has 100 rice trees. John harvests rice once every 3 months. How many rice can John harvest in a year?

Johnny is picking up toys from the floor of his room. He pours a 500-dollar box of Lego on the floor, along with three more Lego sets than the 500-dollar set and one set that is only 1/4 of that amount. If Johnny were to pick up all the Lego sets, how many would he pick up?

Deborah is monitoring a hive to see how many bees are coming in and out of it in a day. She sees 30 bees leave the hive in the first 6 hours, then she sees 1/2 of that number return in the next 6 hours. She sees twice as many bees fly out of the hive and leave in the next 6 hours as she saw the first time.

Brittany and her aunt go to the museum. The ticket is $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's aunt gives the cashier the money for one child and one adult ticket. If she receives $8 for a zero, how many dollars does she give the cashier?
Charlie has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. James has four times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. If Charlie has 12 Facebook friends, how many Facebook friends does James have?

Steve and Tim decide to see who can get home from school the fastest. Steve lives far away from Tim, so he is allowed to ride his bike. Steve lives 3 miles from the school, and he rides his bike at 440 feet per minute. Tim lives 2 miles from the school.

Shawnda decided that the kids in her neighborhood could actually use the bike tire inflation service. She decided that the best way to charge was by the tire. The cost of each tire inflation was 25 cents.
Carl bought 10 bags of cookies. Each bag of cookies contained 6 cookies. Each cookie cost $0.10. How much change would Carl receive if he paid with a $10 bill?

Dave bought a large bag of chips and ate 14 of them before a hungry turtle stole them from his hand. When the turtle landed, it ate half as many chips as Dave had eaten. Then 3 monkeys removed it from the food and each ate 3 chips. Later, a bear stole two-thirds of the remaining chips. The monkey took the last of the chips, leaving 5 of them.

On Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, college student Kimmo has three 1-hour classes per day. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, he has two 2-hour classes per day. There are 16 weeks of school in a semester. How much time does Kimmo spend in class in a semester?

Bill makes 300 rolls of bread, 120 chocolate buns and 60 long sticks of bread every day. Each roll is 4 inches long, each bun is 6 inches long, and each stick is 2 feet long. If Bill connects all the good loaves together, how many feet are they?

The zoo keeper feeds all the monkeys in the zoo. He orders all the bananas from a local farm every two months. If a monkey needs 200 bananas a month, a gorilla needs 400 bananas a month, and a monkey needs 100 bananas a month, how many bananas does he need to order to sustain himself for two months?

Blake and Kelly were having a race to see who could run the furthest in 15 minutes. They decided to play on a 100-yard football field. Blake ran back and forth 15 times. Kelly came back and ran once, then decided she didn't want to run next to Blake, so she started running to the 40-yard line and back.
Rafael went to buy some school supplies. He bought 4 pens (US$1.50 each), 2 notebooks (US$4 each) and a copper pen (US$20 each). How much did Rafael spend on all the supplies?

Finn watches 11 turtles swimming around in the pond. Suddenly, he sees that only 6 of them have emerged from under the dormant lily leaves, and then he sees that only 2 of them are hiding under the stones. How many turtles can Finn see in the pond now?
On Monday, a tank is 17 feet deep. On Tuesday, the water in this tank is 7 feet deep. On Wednesday, the water is two-thirds as deep as Tuesday's water. How deep is the water in the tank on Wednesday?

Anakin and Loxsin went to the beach today. Anakin caught 10 starfish, 6 seahorses and 3 clownfish, while Loxsin caught 5 starfish and 2 seahorses, and Anakin caught 2 clownfish. How many fish did they catch?
If a bag of marble is $20 and the price increases by 20% every two months, how much is a bag of marble after 36 months?

In a room there are all kinds of different toys: 5 red toy cars, 3 toys and a doll. The price of the doll is the same as that of 3 toys, and the price of 1 toy car is $4. If a toy is $5, how much are all the toys worth?

Jay-Z is trying to decide whether to handle her taxes herself or hire an accountant. If she handles her taxes herself, she'll lose 3 hours of freelance work, resulting in a loss of $35 per hour in missed earnings. The accountant costs $90. How much more would she get if she hired an accountant?

For her 30th birthday, Aivera chose a computer with many accessories as a gift. She had a budget of 1,500 euros donated by the whole family and thought she could save some money to buy clothes. She went to a computer store and chose a $1,090 computer, including a screen, keyboard and mouse. She also spent 157 euros on a scanner, 74 euros on a CD recorder, and 102 euros on a printer.

For every time Sandra gives her neighbor's daughter a temporary babysitter, her neighbor gives her a basket of 9 eggs. To make Spanish jam pies, she needs 3 eggs. If Sandra's task is to make 15 Spanish jam pies for her school's fundraising campaign, how many times must Sandra be a temporary babysitter?
Seth is twice Brooke's age. In two years, they will be 28 years old. How old is Seth this year?
Jimmy has twice as much money as Ethel, $2 dollars. If Ethel has $8, how much money does Jimmy have now?
Pancho walks 20 miles a day. Except on weekends, he walks 10 miles. How many miles does he walk in a week?

The marching band is ordering new uniforms. Each uniform is made up of a hat, coat and trousers, each hat costs $25, each coat costs three times the price of the hat, and each trousers costs the average price of the hat and coat. How much is each uniform worth?

Jack is visiting an insect museum. He sees 80 spiders (each with only 8 legs), 90 insects (each with only 6 legs) and 3 rare mutant invertebrates (each with only 10 legs). How many legs does Jack see in total?

There are 4 birds on the wagon. Sally 2 is 3 years older than Grandma Reid. Grandma Reid is twice as old as Sally 4. If Sally 4 is the same size as Sally 32 and Sally 32 is 8 years old, how old are the 4 birds?

Jessica tries to figure out how much she needs to pay off each month for all of her debts. Her student loan has a monthly minimum payment of $300, her credit card has a monthly minimum payment of $200, and her mortgage has a monthly minimum payment of $500. If Jessica wants to pay 50% more than the minimum, how much will she pay off in a year?

Billy is peeling and chopping potatoes to prepare a potato salad for his large family reunion barbecue. It's a huge event, so he has to finish 60 potatoes. The potatoes are all about the same size, and it takes about the same amount of time to peel and chop each potato.

Juan and his brother Carlos are selling lemonade. They use $3 worth of salt and $2 worth of sugar to make a gallon of lemonade. They can make 20 cups per gallon and sell them for $0.50 each. If their profit is $25, how much did they spend on lemonade?
In a tournament with 240 Asians, 80 were Japanese and the rest were Chinese. If China has 60 men, how many women?

Zayed pays rent with 1/4 of his salary, gas with 1/3 of his salary, and donates half of the rest to his favorite charity. He gives his daughter $200 as a weekly expense, and his wife $700 as a budget for daily necessities and other household items. If Zayed earns $6,000 a month, how much money does he have left after paying all these expenses and donations?
If Monique has 40 coins, please calculate the total number of coins owned by three people.
Lloyd was paid $10 an hour as a math teacher. He did five hours of home schooling the first week and eight hours the second week. How much did he make in the first two weeks?

In the school in Surrey, two candidates are running for class representation. If the candidate receives 3/4 of the votes and the total number of students voting in the class is 80, please calculate the number of votes the candidate receives.

Sandra, the owner of a corner flower shop, is very unhappy that Fred doesn't finish the delivery of the order. Sandra orders four times as many red roses as white carnations. She also orders 200 pink carnations, which is five times as many as white carnations. Sandra threatens to change suppliers if the leaked red roses are not delivered by 5 p.m.
Jen is two years older than Mark. Two years ago, Mark was five years older than Jean. If Jean is 30 years old, how old is Jen now?

Two athletic teams compete in a 4x400-meter relay race. In this race, each team has 4 participants, each running 400 meters or a lap around a standard track. Of these two teams, one is very orderly, each team member completes the 400 meters with an accuracy of 55 seconds. The other team is less orderly, the first runner completes the 400 meters in 60 seconds, and then each runner is 3 seconds faster than the previous runner.
Jerry is shaking a six-sided die. How much more likely is it that he will shake a number greater than 3 than that he will shake two even numbers in a row (expressed as a percentage)?
Jenna and her mother picked some apples from their orchard. Jenna picked half as many apples as her mother. If she picked 20 apples, how many apples did they pick?

Russell works in a pet store and is distributing the rodents with the rodents. The rats are kept in 3 cages with the same number of rodents, each rat is divided into 6 cages. The hamsters are kept separately in 10 cages, each hamster is divided into 5 cages.
Mandy owes Benedict $100. They agree to a 2% monthly interest rate. How much money would Mandy have to pay Benedict if she could pay off the debt in 3 months?

A merchant bought several sacks of wheat from a farmer for $20 a sack. If it cost $2 to transport each sack of wheat from the farm to the warehouse, and the merchant made a total profit of $400 after selling all the wheat for $30 a sack, how many sacks did he sell?

Three friends spent $20.25 on three tickets to the amusement park. They also spent $4.50 less on food than those tickets cost. They also played two different amusement parks, each for $33. If they agreed to split all the expenses, how much would they each pay?
John picked peaches for 3 hours. He could pick 2 peaches in a minute. How many peaches did he pick?
A monkey needs 3.5 pounds of insects per week to survive. If there is a group of 10 monkeys, how many pounds of insects do they need per day?
Tom plants 10 trees a year. He also cuts down 2 trees a year. He started with 50 trees. After 10 years, 30% of the trees die. How many trees does he have left?

Sue lives in an interesting neighborhood. One weekend, the neighbors decided to play a prank on Sue. On Friday morning, the neighbors put 18 pink plastic fireflies in Sue's front yard. On Saturday morning, the neighbors took back a third of the fireflies, painted them white, and then put the newly painted white fireflies back in Sue's front yard. Then, on Sunday morning, they added 18 more pink plastic fireflies to the flock.
Violetta wants to buy a new pencil. She needs five different colors of pencils and has $20.00 for the purchase. A pencil costs $2.00. How much change will she receive?
The price of a pencil is the sum of a pencil and a piece of eraser. A pencil is $1.20, a piece of eraser is $0.30. How much is 8 pencils?
200 pounds of carrots are to be distributed to 40 restaurants in a city. Each restaurant receives 2 pounds of carrots. How many pounds of carrots are not used?
The exact number of inhabitants in Soda is 23,786. They include 8,417 men and 9,092 women. The other population is made up of children. How many children are there in Soda?

Elaine started with 20 Pokémon cards. A month later, she collected three times that number. In the second month, she collected 20 fewer cards than she had in the first month. In the third month, she collected twice as many Pokémon cards as she had in the first and second months combined.

Mark is a word editor. He edits the same number of sentences per week for two different publishers, who each pay him different prices per sentence. Publisher B pays Mark twice as much as Publisher A. Mark edits a total of 1,000 sentences per week, and Publisher A pays him 5 cents per sentence.
Baldur draws water from a well. He draws 5 buckets of water every morning and 6 buckets every afternoon. If there are 5 liters of water per bucket, how many liters of water does he get per day?

John was awarded the prize at work. The prize included a $5,000 cash bonus and a 5% raise. If he earned $2,000 a week (for every week of the year) and he won on the first day of the year, how much did he earn that year?
Joanne grows grapes on her 10 acre farm. Each acre produces 5 tons of grapes per year, and each ton of grapes produces 2 barrels of wine. How many barrels of wine does her farm produce per year?

Carl's favorite food is cheese. He has had a sandwich for lunch every day this week, and 2 pieces of cheese for each sandwich. He has had cheese and egg rolls for breakfast for 3 days this week, and 1 more piece of cheese for each egg roll than for each sandwich. He has made a large cheese spread, which has been eaten as a dinner for several dinners this week, and has put 8 pieces of cheese in it.
Janet has 22 green and 10 yellow pens. Then she bought 6 packs of blue and 2 packs of red pens. Each packet of blue has 9 pens and each packet of red has 6 pens. How many pens does Janet have now?

Brinkley is a student in Professor Burt's math class. Professor Burt conducts six exams each semester. He allows students to subtract the minimum score from the average score for each semester. If Brinkley scored 89, 71, 92, 100, and 86 on the first five exams, how many points would he need to take on the sixth exam to reach an average score of 93?

Michael likes to ride his bike. He rides it at least 5 times a week, 25 kilometers each time. He did this for 4 weeks, then he decided to only ride his bike twice a week, but 60 kilometers each time, and he did it for 3 weeks.

Joe's Halloween candy bag contains 25 chocolate bars and 80 candy apples. Each chocolate bar weighs twice as much as each candy apple. If each chocolate bar weighs 40 grams, how many grams does Joe's candy bag weigh?

Ruth went to the store on Monday to buy four cakes. On Tuesday she went to a different store and bought three times as many cakes. On Wednesday she went to another store and bought five times as many cakes as she had bought on Tuesday. How many cakes did she buy in three days?
The total cost of twenty cups is $1,200 less than the total cost of half a dozen plates, which cost $6,000 each. The total cost of each cup is calculated.

Sarah wants to buy herself a new jacket and 2 pairs of shoes. The jacket she wants is $30 and the shoes are $20 each. Sarah looks after the neighbor's kids 4 times and earns $5 for each time she looks after them. For every time she cuts the lawn, her parents pay her $4. If Sarah has saved $10 before she started looking after the kids, how many times does she have to cut the lawn before she can buy the jacket and shoes?

Jerry has a flock of ducks. The red duck lays 3 eggs a day, and the white duck lays 5 eggs a day. Jerry collects 42 eggs a day. If his white duck has two more than the red duck, how many red ducks does he have?
Gary enjoys walking along the edge of the local park, a rectangular park of 1.5 miles by 6 miles. If he walks at 3 miles per hour, how many hours does it take him to walk?

At the one-dollar store, Sloan counts 100 customers entering the store. The next day, she counts 50 more than the first day. If the total number of customers by the third day is 500, how many customers are there on the third day?

Jerry has two pools, each with a gap, which drain at 4 gallons per minute. Four minutes ago, the big pool had twice the amount of water as the small pool. Now the big pool has four times the amount of water as the small pool.
Lori wants to buy a $320.00 pair of shoes and a $32.00 belt. She works part-time and earns $8.00 an hour. How many hours does she have to work to buy them?
If she plans to pay $165 a month for 12 months, how much of the balance will be due to Janis by then?
There are 4 flowers in the vase. The most beautiful flower in the vase is 7 more than the most beautiful flower. How many flowers are there in the vase?
Adrian is three times older than Harriet, and Harriet is half as old as Zach. If Harriet is 21 now, calculate the average age of the three after three years.
Four students scored a total of 251 points in a board game. Naomi scored 68. Uri scored 10 more points than Naomi, and Brianna scored 17 more points than Naomi. How many points did JoJo score?

Carmen takes 10 minutes to complete a word game and 5 minutes to complete a counting game. Over the weekend she completed 3 word games and 8 counting games. How long did it take her to play these games?

A tank holds 120 liters of water. Shirin uses 90 liters of water from the tank to water her small garden. She then collects twice as much rain as she has left over. How many liters of water are there in the tank now?
Andy planted 90 swans and 40 dwarf swans less than the swans. How many flowers did he plant in total?
A company spends $15,000 on advertising in one year and a third of that amount on advertising in another year. What is the total amount the company spent on advertising in those two years?

Carlos and Benji on the beach. Carlos rents a canoe for $30 an hour, Benji rents a banana boat for $18 an hour. If Carlos uses the boat for 3 hours and Benji uses the boat for 5 hours, how much rent do they pay in total?

Andrew plans a road trip from New Jersey to Rochester. It takes six days to travel by bus from New Jersey to Rochester and half as many days to drive. If he plans to travel by bus to Rochester and then drive back from Rochester, how many days would he travel?
James is counting his Pokémon cards. He has 30 Fire, 20 Grass, and 40 Water. If he loses 8 Water and buys 14 Grass, what is the probability that a randomly selected card is Water?

Chad ordered a homemade roll-your-own for lunch. The basic roll-your-own was $6.50. He added an extra $2.00 worth of meat, $1.00 worth of cheese, $1.00 worth of beetroot, and 2 servings of orange juice for $0.25 each. He decided to spend an extra $3.00 to upgrade his own meal, adding chips and a drink. He had a $5.00 gift card to use at the checkout.

Karinda is working on a 360-piece puzzle with her mother. Karinda normally can solve 4 pieces per minute. Her mother can solve half of Karinda's pieces per minute. How many hours did it take them to solve the puzzle?

A watermelon farm produced 120 small watermelons. Ashlyn went to the farm two months later and found that 30% of the watermelons were ripe, so she took them home. When she returned two weeks later, 3/4 of the remaining watermelons were ripe, so she picked them all. How many were still unripe after two weeks?
Mark bought a fleet of 12 cars for his company. Each car sold for $20,000. He paid a 10% tax on these cars and a $1,000 registration fee for each car. How much did he spend on all of this?

Kelly and Robert like to go to the beach to collect shells. On Monday, Kelly collects 5 more shells than Robert, and Robert collects 20 shells. On Tuesday, Kelly collects twice as many shells as she collected on Monday. How many shells did Kelly collect on Tuesday?
When Dax went to pick apples on their farm, he found that the number of insects in the garden was half that of the ants. If there were 50 ants, calculate the total number of insects in the garden.
There are 36 penguins sunbathing in the snow. A third of them jump into the sea to swim. Another third go to the cave to eat. How many more are sunbathing?

Steve decided to start eating more tomatoes and decided to grow his own small tomatoes. He eats twice as much as his girlfriend. He eats 6 a day. If a vine can produce 3 tomatoes a week, how many vineyards does he need?

John ordered some pizza to share with his friends. There were 20 of them, and John wanted to make sure that everyone had four. The pizza was only cut into eight pieces and sold. How many pizzas did John need to order?

Ram uses a lot of pens. He found that he could save money by mixing five empty pens into one full pen. If he bought 25 pens and used them to make new pens when the ink was running out, how many full pens would he get?
Johnny took $20 in spare money and added $10 to the base. He then invested the money and made three times as much in one year. How much money did he have a year later?
If Jessa is 20, how old are the three girls together?

The number of students in a school auditorium is 1,000. The auditorium has 3 entrances A, B and C, which also serve as exits. If after a meeting, 30% of the students exit from A, the remaining 3/5 exit from B, and the rest exit from C, the number of students who exit from C is calculated.
James has six more candies than Robert. John has twice as many candies as Robert. If John has 54 candies, how many more candies does John have than James?
Dolly has two books ‒ Pandora has one ‒ If Dolly and Pandora read each other's books and their own books, how many books would they have read in total?

Mike was pen pals with five people. He was no longer pen pals with two of them. They each sent two five-page letters a week. He responded in the same way. He could write a page every six minutes. How many hours a week did he spend writing letters?

Jason has 1,000 minutes of cell phone time per month. He has to talk to his boss for 15 minutes a day, and this month he has spent 300 minutes talking to other people. If there are 30 days in the month, how many minutes does Jason have left?

Griffin has 24 fries, but Kyle takes 5 of them. Bilina has twice as many as Kyle. Ginny gives Griffin one of hers, and then Corby takes three fewer fries from Griffin than Kyle does. If Griffin has 27 fries, how many fries does Ginny give to Griffin?

There are 4 crocodiles in one tank and 32 crocodiles in the other tank. The difference between the number of crocodiles in the two tanks is twice the number of fish in the two tanks. If the number of fish in the two tanks is the same, how many fish are there in each tank?

Jane's makeup artist charges $250 an hour for her makeup. A film she stars in requires very expensive makeup, 6 hours of makeup a day, and she does it 4 times a week. The film takes 5 weeks to shoot. After the film is done, the makeup artist gives Jane a 10% discount because of the amount of work.

Isabel bought party supplies for her sister's birthday party. She spent $12 on the ingredients for the cake, $43 on the birthday present, $15 on the decorations, $4 on the invitation, and $22 on the gift bags for the party guests. She and her parents split the cost equally. How much did each of them pay?
A cook bought 4 bags of onions. Each bag weighed 50 pounds. A pound of onions sold for $1.50. How much did the cook spend?

On Monday, Sue ate four times as many cookies as her sister. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. Her sister ate five cookies on Monday and 13 the next day. If one cookie contains 200 calories, how many more calories does Sue eat than her sister?
